summary: I've been trying to find this gifset i saw of tony stark flying the suit but I cannot fin it anywhere!!! it was either 2 or 4...
question: I've been trying to find this gifset i saw of tony stark flying the suit but I cannot fin it anywhere!!! it was either 2 or 4 gifs, the first 1/2 were from him learning to fly it in Iron Man 1 and crashing into his car, the last 1/2 were from Civil War I think, when he only had on a boot and a glove but he does this cool flip/twist thing in the air? the caption was basically about how far he's come. I thought maybe you'd seen it and help me find it, or someone on here had seen it? Thank you lol
answer: idk if you refer to this post specifically, but it’s basically the general concept you described. ✌

summary: Question about the arc reactor that Tony has on his chest in Infinity War- is it actually in his chest like the original one? I...
question: Question about the arc reactor that Tony has on his chest in Infinity War- is it actually in his chest like the original one? I thought it was just like, attached to his shirt but I’ve seen several posts saying he put it back in his chest.
answer: From what I understand, it’s not in his chest, no. The infinity war arc reactor contains the nanotechnology for his suit, but it is not a part of his body anymore. It wouldn’t make sense to surgically implant the arc reactor again when he doesn’t need it anymore, but you’re right, I have seen posts saying that it was, but I don’t think that’s right. x

reblog.comment: From what I understand, it’s not in his chest, no. The infinity war arc reactor contains the nanotechnology for his suit, but it is not a part of his body anymore. It wouldn’t make sense to surgically implant the arc reactor again when he doesn’t need it anymore, but you’re right, I have seen posts saying that it was, but I don’t think that’s right. x

trail.content_raw: From what I understand, it’s not in his chest, no. The infinity war arc reactor contains the nanotechnology for his suit, but it is not a part of his body anymore. It wouldn’t make sense to surgically implant the arc reactor again when he doesn’t need it anymore, but you’re right, I have seen posts saying that it was, but I don’t think that’s right. x
trail.content: From what I understand, it’s not in his chest, no. The infinity war arc reactor contains the nanotechnology for his suit, but it is not a part of his body anymore. It wouldn’t make sense to surgically implant the arc reactor again when he doesn’t need it anymore, but you’re right, I have seen posts saying that it was, but I don’t think that’s right. x

title: This Hope is Treacherous
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2n57Iej

by thorbiased

Thor knew deep down that he needed to stop this. That this was denial and this was not healthy and Loki would not want this for him. And yet he did it again. And again. And again. He found little green birds, snakes, and all sorts of creatures. He brought them to Bruce, who tested them patiently and informed him with pain in his brown eyes that it was once again not Loki.

Words: 1981, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe, Thor (Movies)
  • Rating: General Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Characters: Thor, Bruce Banner, Tony Stark, Steve Rogers, James “Bucky” Barnes, Sam Wilson, Wanda Maximoff
  • Relationships: Bruce Banner & Thor, Thor & Avengers Team
  • Additional Tags: Emotional Hurt/Comfort, Thor (Marvel) is Not Stupid, He’s just hopeful, Bruce Banner Is a Good Bro, The team is all together


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2n57Iej

summary:
Steve: Bucky dear, what song do I remind you of?
Bucky: Can't help falling in love
body:
Steve: Bucky dear, what song do I remind you of?

Bucky: Can’t help falling in love <3

Steve: Awww <3

-

Stephen: Tony dear,what song do I remind you of?

Tony: …

Tony: The Wizards of Weverly place theme song…

Stephen:…

Stephen: We’re breaking up.

blog.name: thelastnerd
blog.title: bloody hell
blog.description: the one who supposed to work but only geeks

body:
War in Wakanda

was amazing cause it has the same energy with seeing my old legendary highschool gang together again after Thor showed up, original Avengers had a proud smile on their faces and I’ll change my name if Cap didn’t think something like this: Oh god, Tony should’ve been there..

title: Sugar Pie, Honey Bunch
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2OFy8zB

by freshwoods

Bucky never meant to make a friend in Mrs. “Call me Sarah, Sugar Pie” Rogers, yet he wouldn’t change it for the world. With the looming prospect of a baseball-filled summer for his nephew, a work schedule at his flower shop that will probably kill him, and the hope of maybe finally meeting Sarah’s son, Bucky thinks this summer will shape up to be an interesting one after all.

Words: 40649, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe, Captain America (Movies)
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply

tags: i love a man who is willing to change and grow and surrounds himself with friends and peers he knows will challenge him to be better
summary: anyways, friendly reminder that mcu tony stark’s “narcissism” is just a mask he wears for his flashy public persona to fit the...
body: anyways, friendly reminder that mcu tony stark’s “narcissism” is just a mask he wears for his flashy public persona to fit the publics idea of what they think he should be, he’s the one marvel hero who consistently admits out loud that he’s wrong, apologizes, attempts to remedy his mistakes not just with words but action, asks for input & advice from people he respects, and from the very beginning populates his inner circle with people who will challenge him & aren’t afraid to call him out on anything and everything
